meanings.definition: The state or quality of being soggy.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the sogginesses of the ground made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The sogginesses of the towel made it unpleasant to use.
meanings.sent3: The sogginesses of the sandwich made it feel like a sponge.
meanings.sent4: Her mood matched the sogginesses of the weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The sogginesses of the bread was so extreme that it fell apart in my hands.

meanings.sent1: The sudden sogginesses of the paper surprised me.
meanings.sent2: I could see the sogginesses of the cereal as it soaked up the milk.
meanings.sent3: The sogginesses of the cookies happened faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: The sogginesses of the leaves underfoot signaled the start of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The sogginesses of the cake was a result of leaving it out in the rain.
